name: 'Faith Based Initiatives' Quiz / Test | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was Helen's response when Matt told her that Josh wanted him to run for President?
questions.explanation:
"Of the United States?".

	Helen and Matt were in bed with the kids sleeping between them when Matt told her what Josh wanted him to do. When Helen asked if Josh meant of the United States, Matt said, "I'm pretty sure."

questions.text: Major Gordon told everyone that temperature can bring on an MS attack so what did he suggest the Oval Office temperature remain?
questions.explanation:
Below 70.

	CJ, Abbey, Curtis, Charlie, and Doctor Gordon met to discuss what the President could and couldn't do after his MS episode aboard Air Force One. Besides the temperature, Doctor Gordon also told them that the President would need a nap during the day. Charlie said he was going to love that.

questions.text: After quitting her job, where did Donna go to look for work?
questions.explanation:
Vice President Russell.

	After looking at Donna's resume, Will told her that they could find her a job and not as an assistant.

questions.text: What was one of the thing that Josh's new secretary, Marla, didn't do?
options: Call Josh and tell him she didn't respond to being yelled at
Make him handle one thing at a time
questions.explanation:
Dress him.

	Marla was the temporary secretary that was hired to take Donna's place after she quit. The only thing viewers didn't see Marla do while working for Josh was dress him. Josh said he lost out on the temp lottery. Cleo King played Marla Whorisky.

questions.text: Santos added a tenth point to Josh's nine-point plan to become President of the United States and the tenth point was Josh.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Santos arrived at Josh's office and told him he wanted to add a tenth point to the nine-point plan. Josh quit at the end of the episode to begin Santos campaign for President.

questions.text: When entering her office for the morning meeting, what did CJ find wrapped in a ribbon on her desk?
questions.explanation:
Basketball.

	Everyone was already in the room for the morning meeting when CJ walked in. After taking the bow off the basketball, CJ dunked the ball into the wastebasket. After seeing the dunk, Josh told her that he had never been more attracted to her in his entire life. The basketball was a gift from the staff after they read the article that inferred CJ was a homosexual and that she wanted to be a WNBA coach.

questions.text: Who made the suggestion that the public never be able to see what goes on in a morning meeting?
questions.explanation:
Annabeth.

	Everyone was making jokes about CJ and goofing off and that's why Annabeth suggested the public never see the morning meetings.

questions.text: How tall did Annabeth tell CJ she was?
questions.explanation:
4'11".

	CJ and Annabeth were walking side by side when Annabeth told CJ how tall she was. CJ said she couldn't believe she and Annabeth were of the same species.

questions.text: What member of Vice President Russell's family did he say was gay?
questions.explanation:
His nephew, Todd.

	Toby was talking to the Vice President about the rider to ban gay marriage and that's when the Vice President told Toby that he had a nephew that was gay.

questions.text: Did CJ admit to the press that she was a homosexual?
questions.explanation:
No.

	In Leo's office, CJ told him that she was a heterosexual and was seeing someone, but when she went to talk to the press she neither confirmed or denied that she was a homosexual.
